service.description: Garbage or recycling cans that have been left out for more than 24 hours after collection. Violators will be cited.
Metal construction plate covering the street or sidewalk has been moved.
Sidewalk curb or ramp has problems such as cracking, missing pieces, holes, and/or chipped curb.
Damage to a city garbage receptacle such as missing parts (lid, door, liner) or other physical damage.
Damage to a side sewer vent cover with problems such as cracking, bending, rusting, or denting
Damage to a city maintained tree. To check whether a tree is city maintained: http://bit.ly/6hsDk1
Graffiti on a bike rack that does not contain racial slurs, profanity, or gang related language
Graffiti on a news rack that does not contain racial slurs, profanity, or gang related language
Graffiti on a parking meter that does not contain racial slurs, profanity, or gang related language
Graffiti on a pay phone that does not contain racial slurs, profanity, or gang related language.
Graffiti on a privately owned building or structure that does not contain racial slurs, profanity, or gang related language
Graffiti on a privately owned building or structure that contains racial slurs, profanity, or gang related language
Graffiti on public property (building, pole, sidewalk, hydrant, etc) with racial slurs, profanity, or gang related language
Identify someone that has dumped or is dumping furniture or garbage onto the street or sidewalk. Violators will be cited
Request maintenance on public property (except on park property) such as lawn mowing, bush or strip trimming and removal
Street cleaning sweeper did not show up as scheduled according to the street cleaning signs
The 4" side sewer vent cover (http://bit.ly/57BlOv) is missing from the sidewalk
City receptacle is overflowing and/or has garbage on and around the container
Request that a city maintained tree (except on park property) be trimmed. To check whether a tree is city maintained: http://bit.ly/6hsDk1
Defect on the street such as broken, cracked, and sinking asphalt or concrete
Sewage or dirty water coming out of a catchbasin (located at the corner of intersections)
Sewage or odor coming out of a 4 inch side sewer (http://bit.ly/57BlOv) located on the sidewalk
Have garbage or human waste removed from the sidewalk and/or request services such as steam cleaning of sidewalks
Defect on the sidewalk such as broken, cracked, and/or sinking concrete
Request to have garbage or human waste removed from the street
Tree is damaging property (except for parks) or housing structure. City will address problem if it is a city maintained tree otherwise the property owner is notified to correct the issue
Graffiti on a street sign such as a stop sign, street name, and/or other parking and traffic signs
Odor coming out of a 4 inch side sewer (http://bit.ly/57BlOv) located on the sidewalk.
Sewage or dirty water coming out of a manhole cover (typically located in the a street or alley)
Sewage or dirty water coming out of a sewer vent (located on the sidewalk)

Signs, posters, flyers: Affixed Improperly; Multiple Postings; Posted on Directional Signs, Historic Street Light, Traffic Light; Posted Over 70 Days; Posting Too High on Pole; Posting Too Large in Size

service.service_name: Garbage and/or overgrowth on vacant lot
service.description: Blighted property: Garbage and/or overgrowth on a vacant lot
Blighted property: Garbage and/or overgrowth near a building or structure
Report a damaged bench on city property.
Report a damaged bike rack on city property.
Report a damaged kiosk or public toilet on city property.
Report a damaged news rack on city property.
Report a damaged parking meter on city property.
